text: Like snow in summer and rain in harvest,So honour is not fitting for a fool.
Like a sparrow in its flitting, like a swallow in its flying,So a curse without cause does not come to rest.
A whip is for the horse, a bridle for the donkey,And a rod for the back of fools.
Do not answer a fool according to his foolishness,Or you will also be like him.
Answer a fool as his foolishness deserves,So that he will not be wise in his own eyes.
One who sends a message by the hand of a foolCuts off his own feet and drinks violence.
Like legs that are useless to the lame,So is a proverb in the mouth of fools.
Like one who binds a stone in a sling,So is one who gives honour to a fool.
Like a thorn that sticks in the hand of a heavy drinker,So is a proverb in the mouth of fools.
Like an archer who wounds everyone,So is one who hires a fool or those who pass by.
Like a dog that returns to its vomit,So a fool repeats his foolishness.
Do you see a person wise in his own eyes?There is more hope for a fool than for him.
The lazy one says, “There is a lion on the road!A lion is in the public square!”
As the door turns on its hinges,So does the lazy one on his bed.
The lazy one buries his hand in the dish;He is weary of bringing it to his mouth again.
The lazy one is wiser in his own eyesThan seven people who can give a discreet answer.
Like one who seizes a dog by the earsIs a passer-by who meddles in strife not belonging to him.
Like a maniac shooting flaming arrows and death,
So is a person who deceives his neighbour,And says, “Was I not joking?”
Where there is no wood, the fire goes out,And where there is no gossiper, conflict quiets down.
Like charcoal to hot embers and wood to fire,So is a contentious person to kindle strife.
The words of a gossiper are like dainty morsels,And they go down into the innermost parts of the body.
Like a silver coating on earthenwareAre burning lips and a wicked heart.
One who hates disguises it with his lips,But he harbours deceit in his heart.
When he speaks graciously, do not believe him,For there are seven abominations in his heart.
Though his hatred covers itself with deception,His wickedness will be revealed in the assembly.
One who digs a pit will fall into it,And one who rolls a stone, it will come back on him.
A lying tongue hates those it crushes,And a flattering mouth causes ruin.
